revised_title: A Historical Overview of Atmospheric Circulation Theories
tldr: This article provides a historical overview of the development of theories on atmospheric circulation, focusing on the contributions of James Thomson and George Hadley. It discusses the progress of observational and theoretical research into the nature and causes of trade winds and other persistent currents of atmospheric circulation. The article highlights the importance of Hadley's theory and its influence on subsequent theories, while also mentioning other notable theories and researchers in the field.
